org.projectnyx.command

Interface UIText

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StaticPlainText

    public interface UIText

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default String asHTML(CommandIssuer issuer)
      Returns an HTML-encoded text for a specific command issuer.
      String get(CommandIssuer issuer)
      Returns a plain text preprocessed for a specific command issuer.
      default String toANSI(CommandIssuer issuer) 
      default String toMinecraft(CommandIssuer issuer)
      Returns a text encoded with Minecraft color codes (§*).

    • Method Detail

      • get

        String get(CommandIssuer issuer)

        Returns a plain text preprocessed for a specific command issuer.

        A common usage of the issuer parameter is to translate to that issuer's locale.

        This method should return a consistent value if null is passed in.

        Parameters:
        issuer - the CommandIssuer whom this text will be preprocessed for. If null, a default value should be returned.
        Returns:
        unformatted text

      • asHTML

        default String asHTML(CommandIssuer issuer)

        Returns an HTML-encoded text for a specific command issuer.

        The default implementation redirects to get(CommandIssuer) and escapes special HTML characters in it.

        Parameters:
        issuer - the CommandIssuer to preprocess for or null.
        Returns:
        HTML-encoded text
        See Also:
        get(CommandIssuer)

      • toMinecraft

        default String toMinecraft(CommandIssuer issuer)

        Returns a text encoded with Minecraft color codes (§*).

        The default implementation redirects to get(CommandIssuer).

        Parameters:
        issuer - the CommandIssuer to preprocess for or null.
        Returns:
        A text formatted using MCPE color codes
        See Also:
        get(CommandIssuer)

      • toANSI

        default String toANSI(CommandIssuer issuer)
